source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_00<tab>Though he is less than the picture of perfect health, Gosetsu is ready to resume his journey to Yanxia.
target: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_00<tab>イサリ村のゴウセツは、しみじみと嬉しそうな様子だ。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_01<tab>Owing to the timely intervention of Confederate forces, Yotsuyu and her imperials have been driven from Isari, and their former captives managed to survive their ordeal. Despite his assurances, Gosetsu is clearly still troubled by the injuries he sustained from Grynewaht's brutal interrogation. Nevertheless, you decide to carry on and resume your journey to Yanxia.
target: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_01<tab>海賊衆の協力を得て、冒険者たちの存在を知られることなく、イサリ村は解放された。無事に戻ったゴウセツから、ヤンサへの出発を提案された。「ヤンサ」へ向かおう。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_02<tab>Life. Liberty. Hope. All this and more have the Garleans tried to take from the Domans. Everywhere you look you are confronted by evidence of the failed rebellion and the vicious reprisals which followed. Yet the imperial soldiers are conspicuous by their absence...
target: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_02<tab>ヤンサに足を踏み入れた。ヤンサのアオサギ滝付近にいる「ゴウセツ」と話そう。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_03<tab>Zenos had no desire to remain in Doma after he crushed the rebellion, and so he named Yotsuyu to serve in his stead. The acting viceroy waged an indiscriminate campaign of terror, marching into villages without warning and committing unspeakable atrocities in the name of rooting out “radical elements.” After a time, these purges ceased, but the memory remains, and with it the promise of punishment should the people resist. And so there is little need for imperial patrols.
target: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_03<tab>ゴウセツから、ヤンサの状況について説明された。ヤンサのナマイ村付近にいる「ゴウセツ」と再度話そう。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_04<tab>Gosetsu leads you to Namai, a humble farming village a little ways to the west. Yet even though you see no signs of imperial soldiers, it would be exceedingly reckless to simply saunter into the village...
target: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_SEQ_04<tab>ゴウセツと話した。この先のナマイ村には、人が生活している気配があるようだが……。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_LYSE_000_000<tab>This is it. We're finally headed into the heart of Doma. I can't help but be a little nervous...
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_LYSE_000_000<tab>いよいよ、ドマの中心地か……。
少し、緊張するね。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_005<tab>According to my map, the plains of Yanxia lie to the west. Of note is the One River, upon the shores of which Doma was built...
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_005<tab>地図によると、「ヤンサ」はここからさらに西……。
紅玉海に流れ込む巨大な川「無二江（むにこう）」の、
流域付近を指しているわ。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_010<tab>You did well, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Were it not for the tremendous strength and bravery of you and yours, many innocent souls would have suffered terrible fates.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_010<tab>世話をかけたな、<var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>殿。
おかげで拙者も、ほかに尋問にかけられていた者らも、
なんとか無事に解放されたでござる。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_011<tab>Though I knew the Confederacy would be loath to meet the imperials in battle, I also knew that if any could win them over, it would be you.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_011<tab>海賊衆との協力なぞ、
無理難題をふっかけたかと思ったものでござるが、
ここまでしっかと手を組んでみせるとは……。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_012<tab>Truly, yours is a heroic spirit that inspires men to rise above their circumstances─to strive for something greater! It will be an honor to travel with you again.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_012<tab>まこと、あっぱれな御仁らよ！
かくなる上は、ドマ人として、誠心誠意この恩に報いねば。
再び旅の道連れとして、よろしく頼むでござるッ！

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_013<tab>Now then, let us not squander the Confederacy's gift. Yanxia and my countrymen await!
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_013<tab>……さて、海賊衆にもらった猶予を無駄にはできぬ。
さっそくだが、「ヤンサ」の地に向かうとしよう。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_014<tab>There is a tunnel to the southwest. We need but follow it to reach our destination. With me!
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_014<tab>かの地へは、ここより南西にある洞窟から入るのがよい。
いざいざ、参ろうではござらんか！

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_LYSE_000_020<tab>This place, I...I don't know what I expected.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_LYSE_000_020<tab>なんでだろう……
エオルゼアにも山道なんていくらでもあるけど、
雰囲気がまったく違うね。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_025<tab>There's a weariness. A desolation. An emptiness...
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_025<tab>ここはもう、ヤンサの域内みたいね。
……もっと物々しいのを想像してただけに、意外だわ。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_031<tab>Ere we proceed further, I should speak of Yanxia and what became of her. Of what lies beyond that great wall at the heart of Doma.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_031<tab>皆、遠路はるばる、ようこそおいでくださった。
ここはヤンサ……先の説明どおり、
祖国ドマの城郭が据えられた、国の中心地でござる。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_032<tab>And we should be glad to hear it, but is it wise for us to have this conversation here, on the road, out in the open?
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_032<tab>だとしたら……ねえ、ゴウセツ。
私たち、こんなに堂々と道を歩いていて大丈夫なの？

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_033<tab>Once, your caution would be warranted...but no longer.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_033<tab>うむ……。
拙者もエオルゼアに渡る前の状況しか知らぬが、
伝えておくに越したことはなかろうな。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_034<tab>Zenos did not linger after he crushed the rebellion. He appointed Yotsuyu to act in his stead and quit these lands for “fresh sport.”
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_034<tab>1年前、ドマ反乱軍をほぼ壊滅させたゼノスは、
代理総督の座にヨツユをつけ、この地を去った……。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_035<tab>The acting viceroy was no less merciless than her master. Without warning, her men would march into villages and search for “radical elements,” killing and torturing any who dared resist. And then, as quickly as they had come, they left.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_035<tab>以降、ヨツユは気まぐれに各地へ出向き、
過剰なまでの反乱分子狩りをはじめおった。
……これが「粛清」にござる。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_036<tab>Satisfied that the memory of the purges would keep the people in line, she relaxed her grip on Yanxia. What need for the leash when the dog is broken...
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_036<tab>粛清がすんだ土地は、旧来の監視体制に戻ると聞く。
腹立たしい話ではあるが、海賊衆の言ったとおりであれば、
ここらの監視はもう、さほど厳しくはなかろう。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_037<tab>The village of Namai lies to the west. Though I doubt the imperials are present, let us proceed with caution.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_037<tab>ちょうど、この先に「ナマイ村」という村がある。
行って、今の状況を確かめるでござる！

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_LYSE_000_040<tab>It seems peaceful enough to me...
target: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_LYSE_000_040<tab>ここから見るかぎりでは、のどかな村だけど……。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_045<tab>Even if there aren't any soldiers in the village, it would be foolish to simply stride in and announce ourselves.
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_ALISAIE_000_045<tab>いくら監視が緩くなっているはずとはいえ、
いきなり村に飛び込むのはね……。

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_050<tab>There she is─the humble village of Namai! How delicious her rice; how sweet her persimmons!
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_050<tab>よし、そろったな。
この坂の上にあるのが「ナマイ村」でござる。
ここでとれた米と、デカデカとした柿はうまいぞぅ！

source: TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_051<tab>Too long has it been since I saw her with my own eyes. And, for a mercy, the imperials appear to be absent...
target:
TEXT_STMBDA315_02491_GOSETSU_000_051<tab>拙者も、反乱以降はろくに訪れておらぬが、
ソレ、人の生活する気配がしおる。
あとは、帝国兵がおらねばよいのでござるが……。
